title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 28 February - BBC News
summary: snow and cold closes dozens of schools .
non-essential ambulance services cancelled because of weather .
routes closed due to freezing conditions .
pile up on a1 shuts road in both directions in notts .

documents.title: three held over fatal leicester blast
text: three held over fatal leicester blast

documents.title: christening photo solves camera puzzle
text: christening photo solves camera puzzle

documents.title: m1 fatal crash lorry driver 'felt faint '
text: m1 fatal crash lorry driver 'felt faint '

documents.title: breakingmansfield set to appoint flitcroft
text: breakingmansfield set to appoint flitcroft

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: hosted live coverage on this page is now over for wednesday , but some news , sport and travel will appear automatically overnight .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: authority approves council tax rise
text: council tax bills across nottinghamshire are to go up by almost 5 % from april .
the county council approved its budget for the next financial year at a meeting this afternoon .
the rise is made up of a 2 % levy to pay for adult social care and a 2.99 % increase to base council tax .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: derbyshire schools to close because of snow
text: there schools will be shut again tomorrow because of the severe weather
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: council hands over running of libraries to charity
text: a charity is to take over the running of ten libraries in derby .
derby city council 's confirmed that the charity direct help and advice ( dha ) will take over the libraries .
the authority added that dha has been through a robust evaluation process .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: a1 still shut after 16-vehicle crash
text: highways england tweets
# a1 remains closed in both directions between # a57 # a614 # markham and b6387 # elkesley due to a multi vehicle collision .
@ twitterid and @ twitterid remain on scene .
recovery ongoing
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: will these freakshakes bring all the kids to the dales ?
text: have you ever tried a freakshake ?
it is a new type of milkshake topped with a pudding - but it has a whopping 1,700 calories .
that 's prompted a warning from derbyshire county council .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: investigation into police use of force
text: nottinghamshire police is being investigated for the way officers used force during an arrest in sneinton earlier this month .
on 3 february a 44-year-old man was arrested after reports of a disturbance at the junction of devon street and carlton road .

the man was driven in a police van to bridewell police station - during his detention he was taken for hospital treatment where it was found he had head injuries including a fractured cheek.nottinghamshire police referred itself to the independent office for police conduct ( iopc ) which is now investigating .
the iopc would like to hear from anyone who saw or recorded what happened to help them with their investigation .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: football : stags to poach robins ' boss ?
text: swindon boss david flitcroft is the early bookies ' favourite to take over as mansfield town manager .
flitcroft ( right ) took over at the robins in the summer and they currently occupy the final league two play-off place .
other names being mentioned by bookmakers for the vacancy include ex-hull and southend manager phil brown and former birmingham and huddersfield boss lee clark .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: police work to reopen a1 after multi vehicle crash
text: the a1 is still closed in both directions near retford after a 16 vehicle pile-up on the southbound carriageway .
five lorries are among the vehicles involved in the crash that happened at about midday .
injuries are believed to be minor at this time .
meanwhile the northbound carriageway is at a standstill because of the weather , police said .
nottinghamshire police has said it is `` working hard '' to get the road reopened .
drivers are being asked to avoid the area .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: medals of man 'who could have saved titanic ' for sale
text: medals belonging to a man who `` may have unwittingly caused the titanic to sink '' are to be sold .
david blair forgot to hand over a key to a crow 's nest locker containing binoculars when he was taken off the ill-fated liner at the last minute .
the doomed steamer famously hit an iceberg on its maiden voyage across the atlantic .
murray shaw , who owns the medals , said mr blair could have helped steer the ship to safety .

documents.title: rugby : tigers ' owen out for the season
text: leicester tigers centre gareth owen looks set to miss the rest of the season .
owen dislocated his shoulder in the second minute of tigers ' premiership victory at saracens .
the medics got it back in at the weekend , but he 'll have surgery on that early next week and it 'll probably put him out for the rest of the season . ''
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: death of bbc local radio presenter announced
text: the former bbc local radio presenter jeff harris has died today .
the news was announced on facebook this morning by fab fm , a radio station he 'd helped to launch in 2014 .
mr harris , who worked for a number of commercial stations in the midlands , including mercia fm and leicester sound , also presented on bbc derby and bbc coventry and warwickshire .
author: Allen Cook
BBC News

documents.title: plough needed to clear derbyshire roads
text: drivers warned to `` take care '' on the a6 near taddington .
we have cleared the accident on the a6 at taddington , but it has snowed since and needs to be ploughed again .
it is passable with care .
take care out there .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: snow causes flights to be cancelled and delayed
text: east midlands airport has reported some disruption to flights because of the snowy conditions .
flights to and from glasgow , guernsey , edinburgh , dublin and amsterdam have been cancelled .
15:00 - adverse weather has caused disruption to our flight schedule : there have been a number of delays & cancellations , so please check your flight status with your airline .
for advice on travelling in snowy conditions , please visit : # snowday
you 're far from fully operational as stated on web site .
pls change as this could mislead people

hi sam , the flights cancelled are due to the originating airports being un-operational and aircraft not reaching us , thus airlines deciding to cancel individual flights case by case - all parts of our airport are operational .
ema .
both airports affected .
a suggestion would be to put on your web site alerts to say some inbound flights cancelled # pedantic
the flights that have been affected by weather can be found here : ( linked from our weather advice page ) .
in addition , regular updates across our social media channels are issued , as well as updates via the airlines .
ema .
# snowday2018
keep up the good work of keeping ema open
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: derbyshire schools planning to shut because of snow
text: dozens of schools closed across derbyshire today with several already announcing they will remain shut tomorrow because of the snow and freezing conditions .
they include :

documents.title: warning of yet more snow and cold temperatures
text: the snow showers should ease later this afternoon however it 's not over yet .
there is a yellow warning for more snow all day tomorrow across the east midlands .
snow showers are expected along with very low temperatures .
there 's the potential for a further 15cm of snow in some places .
strong winds will likely lead to drifting of snow , as well as a severe wind chill .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: non-emergency patient transport cancelled
text: east midlands ambulance service has cancelled all non-emergency patient transport journeys because of the snow .
patients who have appointments for vital treatment , such as chemotherapy and dialysis , and patients leaving hospital , will be prioritised .
anyone with a friend or relative due to be discharged from hospital today or tomorrow is asked you to help by collecting them if possible .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: trams delayed in and around nottingham
text: are you getting the tram this evening ?
service update : as our peak service begins please be aware that you may experience a longer wait time for your tram of between 15 and 25 minutes .
we are running to all destinations and apologise for any delay to your travel .
hi , how long before the tram to phoenix park ?
i 'm at the royal centre .
hi emma .
we hope that you got your phoenix park tram and please accept our apologies for not responding as quickly as we should
i did thank you .
thanks so much for the reply !
can we use tickets on nct buses because of the delays
with those waits , we 're going to have an issue of people not being able to actually get on the trams even worse than this morning
will the buses be accepting your tickets ?
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: owner of missing camera found 165 miles away
text: here 's a nice story to warm you up in the bitter cold .
yesterday , derbyshire police released images from a camera found in derby - on it were family christening photos .
the police were hoping that putting the photos online would help track the owner of the camera down .
less than 24 hours after the images were released , the owner has been found 165 miles away in somerset - and he did n't even know it was missing .

david trotham of woolavington , somerset , said : it really is a remarkable story , i had loaned the camera to one of my sons who is taking a zoology degree at the university of derby he had a fall on his bike last week and we think the camera must have fallen out if his back-pack . ''
he continued : i would really like to thank the person who handed it in , the derbyshire police for making the effort to find me and the people who took the time to help through social media . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: rugby : tait signs new tigers contract
text: matthew tait has signed a new contract at leicester tigers which will keep him at welford road until 2019 .
tait , 32 , made his 100th premiership appearance for tigers in sunday 's bonus point win at saracens .
the versatile back told the leicester tigers rugby show that he knows his job at the club is different to when he joined in 2011 .
obviously the role changes a little bit as you get older .
that role for me is basically coming off the bench and making an impact or being someone who can cover a number of positions . ''
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

text: manslaughter charges over jeweller death

text: a large batch of schools have closed in nottinghamshire this afternoon :

documents.title: gritters to keep working through the night
text: gritters , snow ploughs and farmers will be working through the night to try to clear the hardest-hit roads in derbyshire , the county council says .
the authority 's website said it expects to be out spreading grit on all major roads in the north and south of the county .
last night , temperatures dropped to -9c in places and are expected to fall even lower this evening .
the council is warning people to travel only if it 's essential .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: derbyshire schools closing
text: two more closing this afternoon due to the weather :
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: new toyotas secure thousands of jobs
text: car firm toyota has announced it will build its new auris model at its factory in burnaston , derbyshire .
thousands of jobs have been secured in the process , with production due to start at the end of the year .
marvin cooke , managing director , said he was `` delighted '' .
`` this news is a great vote of confidence for our uk work force it comes with great responsibility but the news is very welcomed , '' he said .
the site employs more than 2,400 staff .
author: Jonathan Baker
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: toyota to build new auris in uk
text: toyota to build new auris in uk

prolonged heavy snow & freezing temps are causing major road disruption .
five routes remain closed and motorists are experiencing difficulties on many more .
closed routes : a57 snake pass , a6024 holme moss , a53 leek road , a537 cat & fiddle , monks road .
only travel if essential .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

the road is closed southbound and northbound near retford - this is the current scene .

documents.title: ewe think it 's cold outside ?
text: the snow is coming down heavily in derbyshire this afternoon - if you do n't take my word for it , ask these sheep in heanor .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: a community coming together
text: community groups have rallied round to support the emergency services investigating the cause of the explosion on hinckley road in leicester .
a blast on sunday night claimed the lives of five people .
people from all walks of life and backgrounds have pulled together .
among them was the midland langar seva society , a sikh charity that feeds the homeless and those in need all over leicestershire .
the seva society was founded by our guru .
the concept is the whole community dining together , for equality amongst all people in oneness and sharing .
there were about 30 police and rescuers and we just wanted to support them and the fantastic work they are doing .
author: Kamlesh Purohit
BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: weather forces early school closures
text: more derbyshire schools are closing early because of `` adverse weather conditions '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: leicester explosion : four people leave hospital
text: four people taken to hospital after an explosion on hinckley road on sunday night have been discharged from the leicester royal infirmary .
a fifth person who was in hospital with life-threatening injuries is now in a critical but stable condition .
leicestershire police say a search and recovery operation is continuing today at hinckley road which remains closed .
author: Jonathan Lampon
BBC Radio Leicester News Editor

documents.title: walking trail to explore ww1 history
text: a world war one centenary walking trail will provide a unique opportunity to explore melton mowbray 's world war one history .
the town has a rich heritage , and the walk will take the visitor around buildings and landmarks that have a connection to the great war .
the trail is not for just the people of melton , but also visitors to the town and for schools in the district for their project work .
it is an a3 sized map that can be folded and put in your pocket or handbag .
it will cost £ 1 with proceeds going back into the community via the rotary club community projects .
author: Kamlesh Purohit
BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: weather causing increase in emergency calls
text: police in nottinghamshire are asking people to consider whether they `` absolutely '' need to call 999 this afternoon as their phone lines are very busy .

due to the increased risk this weather poses , we are experiencing a higher volume of calls and demand on our officers than usual , and would encourage people to first consider whether they absolutely need to call 101 or 999 , as emergency situations will remain a priority .
thank you for looking after us all x
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: m1 southbound re-opens after van fire
text: fortunately no-one was injured after this van caught fire on the m1 near leicester .
the lanes have now re-opened and traffic is running as normal .
recovery and carriageway clean-up complete following a van fire # m1 southbound between j22 and j21a nr # leicester .
all lanes have been re-opened and earlier delays are easing , pls see the attached from earlier .
safe travels today .
hi can we use these for the leicester mercury ?
will credit you
that 's fine .
thank you .

- we 'll give you copyright credit .
thanks .
absolutely fine with the credit , thank you .

documents.title: major road closed following 'multi vehicle ' crash
text: bad news if you 're planning to use the a1 in nottinghamshire this afternoon .
the road is closed southbound from the retford junction due to a `` multiple car collision '' .
injuries are believed to be minor .
police have said the northbound carriageway is also at standstill due to weather conditions .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: four arrested in bulwell murder investigation
text: police have arrested four people in connection with the murder of a teenager in nottingham .
lyrico steede was stabbed in bulwell at around 19:30 on tuesday 13 february .
the 17-year-old died in hospital six days later .
two 17-year-old boys and an 18-year-old man have been arrested on sus of murder .
a 17-year-old girl has been arrested on sus of conspiracy to commit murder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: snow stops bin collections
text: your bins might not be getting collected today
with weather conditions worsening in some areas , decision has been taken to call all bin crews back to base .
message to residents is pls leave out your containers and we 'll get back to you as soon as it 's safe to do so .
thank you
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: another school closed in nottinghamshire
text: the list of schools closed today keeps growing
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: feeling of 'shock ' surrounding steve evans resignation
text: the chairman of mansfield town supporters association says he 's `` in shock '' after the surprise resignation of manager steve evans and assistant paul rayner yesterday evening .

dean foulkes described it as a `` bolt from the blue '' and added : `` it 's the morning after and honestly i am still stunned they 've decided to go to be honest you go through all sorts of emotions . ''
evans had been in charge for 15 months and took the stags to fifth in the league two table , just two points outside of the automatic promotion places at the time of his resignation .
the club have confirmed that they are looking for a replacement already .

chairman john radford said : `` whilst i am disappointed by the decision , there are no individuals bigger than mansfield town football club the vacant post of manager is surely one of the most attractive in the football league . ''
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: breakingpeterborough appoint evans as manager
text: breakingpeterborough appoint evans as manager

documents.title: paper £ 10 notes no longer accepted on notts buses
text: something to bear in mind as you travel around nottingham
from this thursday ( 1st march ) , paper style £ 10 notes wo n't be accepted on our buses or in the travel centre .
they can continue to be taken to banks for the foreseeable future to be paid in .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: police officer hit by car trying to stop suspected thieves
text: derbyshire police said one of their officers was hit by a car in the early hours of this morning as he tried to stop suspected thieves .
the officer - who did not suffer serious injuries - was called to wragley way in sinfin after reports of two men acting sus
on arrival , police saw one man running away - it was then that a car hit an officer and drove off .
following this , more units were sent to the area and a 30-year old man from nottingham was arrested nearby on sus of theft from a motor vehicle .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: judge admits terror sentence too short
text: judge admits terror sentence too short

author: Chris Fawcett

documents.title: notts man urges people to have prostate cancer test
text: a west bridgford man diagnosed with prostate cancer is backing calls from the actor and comedian stephen fry for men to ask their gp for the blood test which can help it up .
stephen fry revealed last week he 's had surgery to remove his prostate and urged men to have the psa blood test .
it 's available for over 50s , but only if they ask for it .
tim kirby has been having the test for more than a decade and it 's recently helped flag up that he has prostate cancer .

he said : `` the message has got to be , see your gp and ask for the test a lot of men think they know their body and how they feel but you do n't know you 're carrying prostate cancer , you 've no idea at all . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: terrorist has jail sentence extended
text: derby terrorist munir mohammed has had his jail term increased to a minimum of 21 years for plotting a bomb of ricin attack in the uk .
the sudanese asylum seeker had pledged to carry out a `` lone wolf '' mission in communications with an is commander .

last week , mohammed , 37 , of leopold street , derby , and mother-of-two rowaida el-hassan , 33 , of willesden lane , north-west london , were jailed for preparing terrorist acts between november 2015 and december 2016 .
judge michael topolski qc sentenced mohammed to life with a minimum term of 14 years .
the case returned to the old bailey under the `` slip rule '' to alter the sentence for mohammed .
raising the minimum term to 21 years , judge topolski apologised for making an error in calculating the sentence .
author: Press Association

documents.title: further schools closed in derbyshire

author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: 'forgetful ' titanic sailor 's medals auctioned
text: 'forgetful ' titanic sailor 's medals auctioned

documents.title: custard creams and asda doughnuts still in the wrapper
text: a devastated bride is fighting for compensation after saying that the company in charge of catering for her big day dished out asda coleslaw still in the tub and doughnuts still in the wrapper .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: derby ramathon changed name to attract more people
text: derby 's `` ramathon '' had to change its name to `` attract people from further afield '' , according to organisers .

the event which has attracted over 5,000 runners in recent years , had built a following under the `` ramathon '' name but was recently changed to the derby half marathon following a takeover by the run for all programme .

stuart graham , who is in charge of publicising the event , said : `` the feedback we 've had so far has been positive we wanted to take the best bits of the ramathon but also make it more of a national destination for runners and athletes to come here and put something into the city . ''
the race takes place on 3 june .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: jobs at risk as toys r us goes into administration
text: about 3,000 jobs are at risk after toys r us was placed in administration .
the firm has stores in derby , nottingham , leicester , mansfield and chesterfield .
administrators have said they 're looking to find a buyer and all stores would remain open until further notice .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: water problems in ashbourne
text: a number of homes in the de6 postcode area of ashbourne are without water at the moment because of a burst pipe .
severn trent says its engineers are working to fix the problem .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: derby 's 'clean air zone ' plans discussed in london today
text: derby city council is taking its plans to reduce air pollution to the government today , after ministers told the authority it needs to create a clean air zone by 2020 .
the council wo n't reveal its proposals until after the meeting , but had previously said it is against the use of charging zones for the most polluting vehicles .
councillor asaf afzal , cabinet member responsible for the proposals , is hopeful their ideas will be `` well received '' .
he said : `` we 've been working on this for quite a while , we 've spoken to residents and businesses to make sure we have a good proposal to take to london . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: a1 peterborough and stamford closure : 'big recovery operation '
text: the a1 between stamford in lincolnshire and peterborough has reopened after the road was closed because of adverse weather conditions earlier on wednesday .
jack tappin , from highways england , said the organisation `` began noticing some stranded vehicles '' at about 01:00 and `` some jack-knifed lorries '' .
a 20-mile stretch of the road was fully closed while highways officials and police attempted to recover the vehicles , he added .
`` it 's been a very big recovery operation across three counties - cambridgeshire , leicestershire and lincolnshire , '' mr tappin said .
although the road had been gritted in advance , a number of vehicles became stuck and people were trapped for several hours .
highways england worked with ambulance staff and police to `` ensure the safety and welfare '' of people who had become stuck , mr tappin said , adding that no injuries had been reported .

documents.title: community leaders condemn 'bomb factory ' tweet
text: community leaders in leicester have condemned tweets by the former british national party leader , nick griffin , linking sunday night 's explosion on hinckley road to a 'jihadi bomb factory ' .
an hour after the blast at a polish convenience store , nick griffin tweeted that 'leicester is one of the most colonised cities in england , so a jihadi bomb factory might have just gone up '' .
the tweets are trying to create divisions in the community and do n't represent leicester .
people do n't appreciate how close knit our community is here . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: gritters were out in force overnight
text: derbyshire county council has said that over the last 12 hours , more than 69 routes throughout the county have been gritted .
the council 's gritting map shows that main roads between bakewell , matlock , ashbourne , chesterfield and belper were treated as primary locations during the evening .
it also shows routes closed in the high peak area of the county .
gritting vehicles will continue to spread during the day with the cold weather expected to stay for a few days longer .

BBC News

documents.title: cold snap closes oakham school
text: it 's a snow day for more pupils in rutland .
unfortunately are having to close the school today .
we apologise for the inconvenience but have to put the safety of staff and children first .
stay safe everyone xx
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: more derbyshire schools stay shut
text: a number of primary schools in derbyshire have also closed due to the snow and ice - clowne junior school , town end junior school in alfreton , and tibshelf infant and nursery school .
darley churchtown ce primary school will be open from 10:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: freezing weather closes secondary schools
text: the cold weather has led to a few secondary schools in derbyshire opting to close today - lady manners in bakewell , tibshelf community school and highfields school in matlock .
the county council has the latest list here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'bad weather ' closes rutland school
text: no school for pupils at casterton college in rutland today .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: wintry weather closes schools
text: the cold weather has led to a trio of schools in nottinghamshire deciding to stay closed today .
bulwell st mary 's c of e primary school , newark orchard school and the brunts academy in mansfield will all be staying shut .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: stranded cars on rutland route
text: there are also problems near rutland - this road has been closed for several hours .
# a1 remains closed in both directions between the # a1m j17 and the # a6121 # tinwell due to stranded vehicles following severe weather throughout the night .
@ twitterid are on scene with multiple gritters and snow ploughs working to clear the road , pls plan ahead .
is it closed or moving slowly ?
mixed reports online .
appreciate it 's a tough time but just trying to plan journeys .
hi gareth , the road is now open but there is still very slow traffic in the area .
we will update this feed as best we can with all the info we receive , obviously advice is to allow extra travel time .
when will be open again ?
hi john , the road is now open but there is still very slow traffic in the area .
we will update this feed as best we can with all the info we receive , obviously advice is to allow extra travel time .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: cold weather closes routes in derbyshire
text: freezing conditions overnight have led to a number of routes in the high peak area being closed .
these include the a57 snake pass , a6024 holme moss , a53 leek road and a537 cat & fiddle .
derbyshire county council said temperatures had plummeted to -9c overnight , meaning grit fails to stop working fully to melt snow and ice .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: hi everyone .
we 've started today 's live updates a little early to tell you about disruption caused by the freezing conditions .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
